results.title: Force of the wind
results.creator_credit: Justin Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Justin Somerville never thought he would be in the middle of a tornado, so his first reaction was that he wanted to witness this phenomena. His account of the aftermath provides detail well beyond the media coverage of the devestation of this small town.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Justin Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Disastrous day
results.creator_credit: Abby Dietrich, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It was a typical morning in Lennox Head for Abby Dietrich and her mother, when things changed dramatically. A tornado and intense storm were followed by calls from friends and family, and the community checking up on each other, helping out and cleaning up.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Abby Dietrich, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Big, grey and tubey
results.creator_credit: Sage Armstrong, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
When the tornado hit, Sage Armstrong and her mother took shelter in the toilet. Traumatised by the experience, Armstrong was able to find solace in helping others in the aftermath.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sage Armstrong, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My neice
results.creator_credit: Samantha Sharp, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Samantha Sharp may have become an aunty early in her life but she’s glad she is. She plays with her niece in the way that older aunts couldn’t and she cherishes the time they spend together.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Samantha Sharp, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.creator_credit: Charles Skoutariotis, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Most important question in the world
results.creator_credit: Paul Young, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Paul Young went to university, he knew he didn’t want to be a teacher. However, over time, he has seen the value of the profession and learnt that it’s not about the content, it’s about the life lessons.

results.creator_credit: Chris Villarroel, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Birth of a brain : ten billion galaxies (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Claude Edelman, CRM/McGraw-Hill Films and Les Films du Levant
results.brief_description: Looks at the development of the human brain from embryo stage through to the first years of life. Computer graphics, sonography and film of living nerve cells show the process and progress of development at different stages. This is a version of a French documentary, ‘Naissance du cerveau : dix milliards de galaxies’ with a dubbed American commentary.
results.title_for_label: The Birth of a brain : ten billion galaxies (TEFC)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claude Edelman, CRM/McGraw-Hill Films and Les Films du Levant
